item.title: Random Forest
item.description: Random Forest In this post we will explore some ideas around the Random Forest model Data BHData <- read.table(url("https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/housing/housing.data"), sep = "") Set names of the dataset names(BHData)<- c("crim","zn","indus","chas","nox","rm", "age","dis","rad","tax","ptratio","black","lstat","medv") EDA (Exploratory Data Analysis) str(BHData) ## 'data.frame': 506 obs. of 14 variables: ## $ crim : num 0.00632 0.02731 0.02729 0.03237 0.06905 ... ## $ zn : num 18 0 0 0 0 0 12.5 12.5 12.5 12.
